skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown skill with no executable code. Contains only testing guidance, patterns, and best practices. No file access, network calls, or code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Teams often write tests that do not catch bugs or become maintenance burdens. This skill provides the testing pyramid, framework guidance, and anti-patterns to write tests that prove your code works.
actual_capabilities: Enforce testing pyramid (70% unit, 20% integration, 10% E2E)
Recommend stack-appropriate frameworks (Vitest, Jest, pytest, go test)
Identify testing anti-patterns (implementation testing, over-mocking, brittle selectors)
Guide test structure using AAA pattern (Arrange, Act, Assert)
Provide Socratic questions for testing strategy discussions
Flag testing red flags during code review
limitations: Does not execute or generate test code
Does not run existing tests or report coverage
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Review test quality
use_cases.description: Apply this skill when reviewing pull requests to ensure tests follow the pyramid and avoid anti-patterns.

use_cases.title: Define testing strategy
use_cases.description: Use the framework guide to select appropriate testing tools for your stack and establish team standards.

use_cases.title: Learn testing concepts
use_cases.description: Learn what to test, how to structure tests, and which questions to ask when writing tests.

prompt_templates.title: Review test quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these test files for quality. Check if they follow the testing pyramid, avoid anti-patterns, and test behavior not implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Framework guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the best testing framework for a Vite + React project? What about for Node.js native ESM?

prompt_templates.title: Test strategy discussion
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me plan tests for this feature. What should be unit tests, what should be integration, and what critical flows need E2E?

prompt_templates.title: Fix test patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: This test is brittle and testing implementation details. Help me rewrite it to test user-facing behavior.

best_practices: Follow the testing pyramid: 70% unit, 20% integration, 10% E2E
Test user behavior, not implementation details (use getByRole, not getByClassName)
Mock only external boundaries, not your own code
Ask 'Would this test catch a real bug?' before writing
anti_patterns: Testing internal state instead of what the user sees
Mocking everything and losing confidence in tests
Using getByClassName selectors that break with CSS changes
Writing tests just to hit coverage percentages

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill recommend?
faq.answer: Vitest for Vite projects, Jest for CRA, pytest for Python, go test for Go, and Playwright for E2E across stacks.

faq.question: What coverage percentage should I target?
faq.answer: Strategic coverage focused on critical paths. 100% coverage often creates tests that exist just for metrics.

faq.question: Does this skill run tests for me?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance on testing strategy and patterns. It does not execute or generate code.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads text for guidance. No test data is accessed, transmitted, or stored.

faq.question: Why is my test breaking after refactoring?
faq.answer: You may be testing implementation details. Rewrite to test user-facing behavior that stays stable across refactors.

faq.question: How is this different from AI code generators?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on testing strategy and review, not code generation. It asks questions to guide better decisions.
